name: Thai Sweet Pork (Moo Wan Recipe)
description: This Thai sweet pork, or moo wan, has been tested and perfect. Serve with rice for a complete meal.

recipeInstructions.text: Pound garlic, coriander root, and black peppercorns with a mortar and pestle.
recipeInstructions.name: Pound garlic, coriander root, and black peppercorns with a mortar and pestle.

recipeInstructions.text: Fill a pot with enough water to completely cover the pork belly slices. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a gentle simmer. Let the pork belly cook until it’s tender and soft, which should take about 15–20 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Fill a pot with enough water to completely cover the pork belly slices. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a gentle simmer. Let the pork belly cook until it’s tender and soft, which should take about 15–20 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a wok over medium heat and sauté shallots along with the spice mixture and palm sugar until golden and fragrant. The palm sugar should begin to caramelize before continuing.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat oil in a wok over medium heat and sauté shallots along with the spice mixture and palm sugar until golden and fragrant. The palm sugar should begin to caramelize before continuing.

recipeInstructions.text: Create the sauce base by adding dark soy sauce, oyster sauce, fish sauce, and water.
recipeInstructions.name: Create the sauce base by adding dark soy sauce, oyster sauce, fish sauce, and water.

recipeInstructions.text: Let everything simmer slowly. In about 20 minutes, you’ll have pork belly that’s coated in a thick, sticky sauce. Keep an eye on it and occasionally stir to ensure nothing sticks and burns. Serve immediately with rice.
recipeInstructions.name: Let everything simmer slowly. In about 20 minutes, you’ll have pork belly that’s coated in a thick, sticky sauce. Keep an eye on it and occasionally stir to ensure nothing sticks and burns. Serve immediately with rice.
